assessments.status_rationale: Today’s items focus on Venezuela operations/politics and other domestic topics; there is no reporting about Ørsted’s Revolution Wind litigation or a federal judge granting a TRO/preliminary injunction.
No bullet indicates Interior/BOEM issued a new formal pause/suspension directive or Federal Register notice for offshore-wind leasing/permitting lasting 60+ days.
There is no mention of an OFAC Iran-related human-rights/protest-suppression sanctions package or any designations count meeting the threshold.

Although there is Venezuela-related enforcement news (e.g., indictment unsealed), nothing in the bullets indicates DOJ announced a civil forfeiture/seizure involving a named oil tanker for sanctions evasion.
No items reference Tesla announcing a company-wide workforce reduction meeting the stated thresholds.
No items report a coordinated same-day Tesla U.S. MSRP cut of at least 5% on at least two distinct models.
There is no reporting here about Saks Global (or a primary operating affiliate) filing for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection.
No bullet mentions India’s MeitY (or another central authority) issuing a written compliance order to xAI referencing Grok and child sexual content safeguards/takedowns.
No item indicates introduction of a bipartisan U.S. Senate bill to reform the National Emergencies Act with a 60-day congressional-approval extension requirement.
